attributes.action: Stop Glasgow City Council putting their childcare fees up
attributes.additional_details: Glasgow City Council are putting their hourly rate up from this August from £2.51 per hour to £4 then £5 from next year onwards.  This is going to hit working parents hard and low income families and although there might be extra free hours added to 3+4 year olds free entitlement this will have a huge effect on parents with 1 or more children and for those with children who are under 3.  People are trying to make ends meet and this increase is due to insufficient funds to cover free school meals for primary 4 children and to help support their 2020 vision of 30 free hours for 3+4 year olds.
attributes.background: Glasgow City Council fee increase from £2.51ph to £4 August 2018 then to £5ph in 2019

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of the council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

http://www.glasgow.gov.uk/councillorsandcommittees/addressSearch.asp

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www.glasgow.gov.uk/petitions
